p: When the potential overlap between the predictors was taken into account in the Full Models ( Table 2), scepticism and attitude towards addressing climate change (UK survey) and attitude towards environmental protection (Swiss survey) independently explained the largest proportion of variance of support for mitigation policies, followed by distant risk perceptions. Particularly interesting is the predictive power of peopleâ€™s attitude towards environmental protection, which independently explained 13% of the variance in mitigation policy support ( Table 2). This suggests that for many people protecting the environment in general and supporting mitigation policies go hand in hand.
